commitResults.messageTitle: Rename bot, add function to greet user and exit in new class Bot
commitResults.messageBody:
Bot name is Duke.
Print greet message is written in Main.

Change bot name to personalise bot and differentiate from others

The function of printing greeting and exiting message can be grouped under Bot for better maintenance of code and scalability.

Let's
-  Group all Bot relevant operations under the Bot class instead of writing in the Main program

commitResults.messageTitle: Add function to read and echo input command given by the user and exit program with command "bye"
commitResults.messageBody: Add echo and promptUser function under Bot class to allow a Bot to perform these operations

commitResults.messageTitle: Move System.exit() function call from Bot class to main function
commitResults.messageBody:
Bot is handling System exit to end entire program.

Function to end program should belong to main function instead. Logic for bot exiting and program exiting can be separated for clarity

commitResults.messageTitle: Add function to store user-entered text and display text
commitResults.messageBody:
This change introduces a function that captures and stores any text input
the user provides via the console interface, saving it in an array list under bot class for later use or processing.

This change also introduce new function to list all items stored when "list" command is given

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task class for managing tasks and their completion status
commitResults.messageBody:
This change introduces the Task class, which represents a single to-do item
with a name and a completion status. Each Task instance tracks its own
'isDone' state, provides methods to mark the task as done or not done, and
displays status updates via the console.

The Task class includes:
- `name`: The name of the task
- `isDone`: Boolean flag for completion status
- `markDone()`: Sets the task as done and prints confirmation
- `markNotDone()`: Sets the task as not done and prints confirmation
- Overridden `toString()` to display task status and name in a user-friendly format

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functions in Bot class to mark task as done or not done
commitResults.messageBody: This change introduces the 2 new functions in Bot class to mark a task as done or not done given a task index number that is shown when displaying task list

commitResults.messageTitle: Add logic to allow user to update task status via console input
commitResults.messageBody: This change introduces 2 additional switch cases "mark" and "unmark" to allow users to invoke functions to mark task as done or not done with command input via console.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Todo class extending Task to represent to-do items
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduces the Todo class, a subclass of Task, which represents
a specific type of task categorized as a to-do item.

Key additions:
- Constructor for creating a Todo by specifying the task name.
- Overridden toString() method to display the to-do indicator "[T]" along with
  the completion status and task name for improved readability in the console.

This enhancement enables clearer distinction and display of to-do tasks in the
application, laying groundwork for supporting multiple task types in future updates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Task class abstract to enable more specific task types
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit updates the Task class by declaring it as abstract. This change allows for the creation of more specific task subclasses (such as Todo) by enforcing implementation through inheritance rather than direct instantiation.

Now, Task serves as a blueprint for all task types with shared attributes (name, isDone) and behaviors, while preventing the creation of generic Task objects. This improves code structure and extensibility as new task variants are added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Deadline class extending Task to represent tasks with deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduces the Deadline class, a subclass of Task, designed to
represent tasks that have an associated deadline timestamp.

Key features:
- Stores a deadline as a string along with the task name
- Overrides the toString() method to display the task type "[D]", status,
  task name, and the deadline in a user-friendly format

This addition enhances the bot program by supporting tasks with deadline, enabling users to distinguish and track time-sensitive
tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Event class extending Task to represent tasks with start and end time
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduces the Event class, a subclass of Task, designed to
represent tasks that have a start time and end time.

Key features:
- Stores a startTime and endTime as a string along with the task name
- Overrides the toString() method to display the task type "[E]", status,
  task name, start time and end time in a user-friendly format

This addition enhances the bot program by supporting event tasks with start and end time, enabling users to distinguish and track task with a time window.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add 3 overload addTask function in Bot class to add Todo task, deadline task and event task.
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduce a total of 3 overloaded addTask function in Bot class that creates Todo task, Deadline task or Event task based on the parameters given when adding a task. This creates a layer of abstraction for main class where correct type of Task will be created and added with matching parameters and managed by the Bot class.

This function added allows user to create task from interaction with Bot class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add switch cases to handle commands for adding Todo task, deadline task and Event task
commitResults.messageBody: This commit adds 3 more cases to handle command for creating Todo task, Deadline task and Event task and formating of command inputs to invoke respective functions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases with input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT file updated
commitResults.messageBody:
Add test cases to test the following functions:
- Display empty list
- Add todo task
- Add deadline task
- Add event task
- Display task list with task
- Mark task as done
- Mark task as not done
- Add deadline task with incorrect command
- Add event task with incorrect command
- end bot

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new Exception class InvalidCommandException to handle input commands with invalid format
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit introduce a new exception InvalidCommandException that is to be thrown and managed when a command format input by the user is invalid.

This can help to identify specific exception for incorrect command format and program can use this exception to ensure the program is robust even when there is a typo in user input

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling for invalid command when formating user input
commitResults.messageBody:
The program crashes when user input does not match a given format.

This commit implements exception handling of incorrect command format entered by the user and print feedback message with the correct command format.

The feedback message will update user of the correct format which allows user to know the exact correct command to enter instead of guessing for the correct format.

This reduces frustration of not knowing how to resolve the issue on user side, improving user experience and ensure program robustness.

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace error print message for invalid task number with throwing InvalidCommandException
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit replaces the previous approach of printing an error message directly to the console when an invalid task number is encountered with throwing a custom InvalidCommandException.

By using an exception, the code gains better error handling capabilities, allowing calling methods to catch and respond appropriately rather than just logging the error. This improves code clarity, maintainability, and allows centralized management of invalid command scenarios.

This change helps enforce a more structured error flow in the application and prepares the codebase for enhanced user feedback or recovery mechanisms in response to invalid task inputs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for deleting tasks from the list
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit adds functionality to delete tasks from the task list with the command "delete" from user input, enhancing the task management capabilities of the application.

The implementation includes methods to remove a task by its index, with appropriate validations to handle invalid index number. It ensures the task list remains consistent after deletions.
